# Pre

Pre-made graphs for modelling outbreaks.

Import it with:

       const pre = require('@quantalabs/epijs').pre

# sir

The SIR Model. Returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Infected, and Recovered after the given amount of time.

# Parameters

  • c HTMLElement (opens new window) The HTML5 Canvas Element.
  • rn Number (opens new window) R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
  • s Number (opens new window) The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • i Number (opens new window) The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak
  • time Number (opens new window) The time the total simulation lasts.
  • u Number (opens new window) The recovery rate
  • p Number (opens new window) The total population.

# Examples

sir(sirchart, 4, 9999, 1, 100, 1/21, 10000)

# seir

The SEIR Model. Returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, and Recovered after the given amount of time.

# Parameters

  • c HTMLElement (opens new window) The HTML5 Canvas Element.
  • rn Number (opens new window) R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
  • s Number (opens new window) The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • i Number (opens new window) The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak
  • t Number (opens new window) The time the total simulation lasts.
  • u Number (opens new window) The recovery rate
  • a Number (opens new window) The incubation period
  • p Number (opens new window) The total population.

# Examples

seir(seirchart, 4, 9999, 1, 100, 1/7, 1/7, 10000)

# seird

The SEIRD Model. Returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, and Dead populations after the given amount of time.

# Parameters

  • c HTMLElement (opens new window) The HTML5 Canvas Element.
  • rn Number (opens new window) R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
  • s Number (opens new window) The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • i Number (opens new window) The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • t Number (opens new window) The time the total simulation lasts.
  • u Number (opens new window) The recovery rate
  • a Number (opens new window) The incubation period
  • d Number (opens new window) The death rate
  • p Number (opens new window) The total population.

# Examples

seird(seirdchart, 4, 99999, 1, 100, 1/21, 1/14, 1/100, 10000)

# seihrd

The SEIHRD Model. Returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, Hospitalized, Recovered, and Dead populations after the given amount of time.

# Parameters

  • c HTMLElement (opens new window) The HTML5 Canvas Element.
  • rn Number (opens new window) R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
  • s Number (opens new window) The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • i Number (opens new window) The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • t Number (opens new window) The time the total simulation lasts.
  • u Number (opens new window) The recovery rate for the infected population
  • uh Number (opens new window) The recovery rate for the hospitalized population
  • a Number (opens new window) The incubation period
  • di Number (opens new window) The death rate for the infected population
  • dh Number (opens new window) The death rate for the hospitalized population
  • h Number (opens new window) The hospitalization rate
  • p Number (opens new window) The total population.

# Examples

seihrd(seihrdmodelchart, 4, 9999, 1, 265, 1/21, 1/40, 1/14, 1/100, 1/20, 1/30, 10000)

# seihcrd

The SEIHCRD Model. Returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, Hospitalized, Critical, Recovered, and Dead populations after the given amount of time.

# Parameters

  • c HTMLElement (opens new window) The HTML5 Canvas Element.
  • rn Number (opens new window) R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
  • s Number (opens new window) The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • i Number (opens new window) The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak
  • t Number (opens new window) The time the total simulation lasts.
  • u Number (opens new window) The recovery rate for the infected population
  • uh Number (opens new window) The recovery rate for the hospitalized population
  • a Number (opens new window) The incubation period
  • di Number (opens new window) The death rate for the infected population
  • dh Number (opens new window) The death rate for the hospitalized population
  • ch Number (opens new window) The rate at which patients go to the critical stage from the hospitalized compartment.
  • ci Number (opens new window) The rate at which patients go to the critical stage from the infected compartemnt.
  • dc Number (opens new window) The death rate for critical patients
  • uc Number (opens new window) The recovery rate for critical patients
  • hc Number (opens new window) The rate at which a critical patient goes to the hospitalized compartment, and are no longer critical.
  • ic Number (opens new window) The rate at which a critical patient goes to the infected compartment, and are no longer critical.
  • h Number (opens new window) The hospitalization rate
  • p Number (opens new window) The total population.

# Examples

seihcrd(seihcrdchart, 4, 9999, 1, 265, 1/21, 1/40, 1/14, 1/100, 1/20, 1/10, 1/40, 2/5, 1/5, 1/5, 1/5, 1/30, 10000)
